reviewText: It is always good to see Rod Cameron in action. One of the best cowboys in the movies and TV.

Normally I do not care for the spaghetti western, but I thought this was worth a look.  Strictly a B flick.  Standard plot - Bank robbery and murder while Sheriff Pat Garrett is at the church getting married and he has to leave his bride to track down the Clantons.  I got it because Rod Cameron was in it and he had good success in B westerns in the late 40's and 50's.  His storylines in those were generally better than average.  Also he had a couple of good cop shows on TV then.  He played a really likeable Pat Garrett sheriff to perk a standard movie up.  Worth a peek.
Rod Cameron was a fine cowboy actor in the 1940s and in the 1950s turned to television. This spaghetti Western from mid-1960s is fairly pathetic movie.
